content: As an AI language model, I do not have access to the latest data on Abu Dhabi's carbon footprint. However, according to the Abu Dhabi Sustainability Week website, the city has made significant progress in reducing its carbon emissions. For example, as a part of the Masdar City project, the city has created the largest single-site solar plant in the world, which has cut up to 810,000 tonnes of CO2 emissions annually. Additionally, the city has invested in clean transportation and water conservation, which are key components in reducing carbon emissions. Abu Dhabi's efforts to promote sustainability and environmental conservation are ongoing, and it is likely that the city will continue to make progress in reducing its carbon footprint in the years to come.
